message_1: A Cryptographic hash function takes an input message of 1024 bits and produces an output hash value of size 256 bits. If the hash function is applied to a different input message of 2048 bits, what will be the size of the resulting output hash value?
message_2: The size of the resulting output hash value will still be 256 bits. Cryptographic hash functions produce a fixed-size output (hash value) regardless of the input message size.
